message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the design and construction of network-error detecting and correcting codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT) and network science (cs.NI). The use of matroid theory in the framework suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of combinatorial optimization (cs.DS) and the study of structural properties of networks (cs.SI). Finally, the paper discusses the limitations of linear network coding, which is a topic in the field of coding theory (cs.CC).
